text: John Carruthers Little (9 September 1874 - 13 September 1957) was a British trade unionist. Born in Penton in Cumberland, Little became an engineer and joined the Amalgamated Society of Engineers (ASE) in 1897. By 1922, the ASE had become the Amalgamated Engineering Union (AEU), and Little began working full-time for the union. He was elected as the union's president in 1933, serving until 1939."Little, John Carruthers", Who's Who During World War II, Little was a Director of Labour Supply for the Ministry of Labour and National Service.Amalgamated Engineering Union, Journal, vol.1957, p.306 After the war, he served on the Admiralty Manpower Economy Committee and the Committee on Houses of Outstanding Historic and Architectural Interest. Little was made a Commander of the Order of the British Empire in 1941. ==References== Category:1874 births Category:1957 deaths Category:Presidents of the Amalgamated Engineering Union Category:People from Cumbria
